precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CreditPerfRetailLoanToValueRatio
label: Credit Perf Retail Loan To Value Ratio
description: In the case of a purchase mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date by the lesser of the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date or its purchase price. In the case of a refinance mortgage loan, the ratio obtained by dividing the original mortgage loan amount on the note date and the mortgaged property appraised value on the note date. In the case of a seasoned mortgage loan, if the Seller cannot warrant that the value of the mortgaged property has not declined since the note date, Freddie Mac requires that the Seller must provide a new appraisal value, which is used in the LTV calculation. Percentages below 6% or greater than 105% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' indicated by a blank space. In the case of an FHA/VA mortgage loan, percentages less than 6% or greater than 110% will be disclosed as 'Unknown,' which will be indicated by a blank space.

name: Curtail
label: Curtail
description: Amount of curtailment in kWh which is a reduction in the energy output of a generator from what it could otherwise produce given available resources (e.g., wind or sunlight).
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: CurtailEconomicModelFactorAmt
label: Curtail Economic Model Factor Amt
description: Amount of energy lost due to economic curtailment based on major design/energy production model. Economic curtailment is a result of wholesale market pricing, etc. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: CurtailEconomicModelFactorPct
label: Curtail Economic Model Factor Pct
description: Percentage of energy lost due to economic curtailment based on major design/energy production model. Economic curtailment is a result of wholesale market pricing, etc. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CurtailEmergOrConstrModelFactorAmt
label: Curtail Emerg Or Constr Model Factor Amt
description: Amount of energy lost due to curtailment based on major design/energy production model for emergencies or construction work.To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: CurtailEmergOrConstrModelFactorPct
label: Curtail Emerg Or Constr Model Factor Pct

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CurtailLimit

name: CurtailOtherModelFactorAmt

To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CurtailOtherModelFactorPct

Value reported should be based on major design/energy production model. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CurtailStabilityOrCongestionModelFactorAmt

To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: CurtailStabilityOrCongestionModelFactorPct

description: Percentage of energy lost due to stability or congestion curtailment on the transmission system, based on major design/energy production model. validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: CurtailTotalModelFactorAmt

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

Permitting Authority as Authority Having Jurisdiction, Regional Transmission Operator as Authority Having Jurisdiction, Independent System Operator as Authority Having Jurisdiction, Environmental Consultant, Equipment Factory Auditor, Independent Engineer, Insurance Consultant, Equipment Reliability Test Lab, Tax Consultant, Transmission Consultant, Appraiser, Weather Data Provider, Utility, REC Offtaker, General Contractor, Engineering Contractor/Installer, Construction Contractor/Installer, Subcontractor Contractor/Installer, Builders/Construction All-Risk Insurers, Ocean Cargo Insurer, General Liability Insurer, Automobile Liability Insurer, Workers Compensation Insurer, Umbrella/Excess Liability Insurer, Pollution Liability Insurer, Property Insurer, Business Interruption Insurer, Project Performance Insurer, Construction Lender, Back-leverage Lender, Commercial Lender, Personal Lender, LLC Partner Managing Member, LLC Partner Voting Member, LLC Partner Passive Member, Project Developer, Project Host, Long-term Equity Investor, Tax-equity Investor, Lessor, Asset Manager, Back-up Asset Manager, Collateral Agent, Energy Price Forecaster, Hedge Provider, Monitoring Service Provider, Back-up Monitoring Service Provider, Parallel Monitoring Service Provider, Operator, Back-up Operator, Maintenance Provider, Back-up Maintenance Provider, Scheduling Coordinator, Site Security Company, Subcontractor, Telecom Provider, Trustee, Energy Forecasting Service, Equipment Warranty Provider, Construction Warranty Provider, Site Owner/Site Control, Equipment Manufacturer, PPA Offtaker, COP Backup Provider, Bank.

name: EstArrayDegradRate
label: Est Array Degrad Rate
description: Estimated percent capacity of the array lost in future periods, e.g., year, month, due to degradation. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: EstSystemDegradRate
label: Est System Degrad Rate
description: Estimated degradation rate of the system, in percent of kWh lost. To report estimated values for specified future periods, use the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis, in conjunction with the concept EstimationPeriodForCurtailment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: EstimationPeriodForCurtail
label: Estimation Period For Curtail
description: Period in which the curtailment amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: EstimationPeriodForDegradMeas
label: Estimation Period For Degrad Meas
description: Period in which the degradation amount or percent is estimated, in 'PnYnMnDTnHnMnS' format, for example, 'P1Y5M13D' represents reported fact of one year, five months, and thirteen days, or 'P1Y' represents a reported fact for one year, or 'P1M' represents a reported fact for one month. Should be used with the EstimationPeriodStartDateAxis which represents the starting date for the period.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: ExciseAndSalesTaxPerWatt
label: Excise And Sales Tax Per Watt
description: The amount of excise and sales taxes included in sales and revenues, which are then deducted as a cost of sales. Includes excise taxes, which are applied to specific types of transactions or items (such as gasoline or alcohol); and sales, use and value added taxes, which are applied to a broad class of revenue-producing transactions involving a wide range of goods and services.  Value should be reported as amount per watt. The StatementScenarioAxis should be used to report values that are predicted. No axis should be used to report values that are actual.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: ExpectEnergyAtArrayDC

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAtP50

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: ExpectEnergyAtRevenueMeterInceptToDate
label: Expect Energy At Revenue Meter Incept To Date
description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. Measured from inception to date.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter
label: Expect Energy At The Revenue Meter
description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3.  This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example the first day of the month to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod
label: Expect Energy At The Revenue Meter For Period
description: Expected Active Electrical Production at the revenue meter for indicated time period in kWh per IEC 61724-3 using measured weather data during times of availability and including adjustments for parasitic losses. See Section 6.6.6 of IEC 61724-3. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period of measurement and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimes
label: Expect Energy At Unavail Times
description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when it’s status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAtUnavailTimesExcludExtOrOtherOutages
label: Expect Energy At Unavail Times Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be unavailable when it’s status is observed to be non-functional.This measure reports the amount of energy that is unavailable, excluding issues that are outside of the plant's control.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectEnergyAvailEstRatio
label: Expect Energy Avail Est Ratio
description: Expected Energy Availability Estimate is modelled predicted energy for unity availability, and can be calculated by dividing ExpectedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter by Predicted_Energy_Availability. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: ExpectEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutages
label: Expect Energy Available Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
description: Expected energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: ExpectInsolationAtP50
label: Expect Insolation At P50
description: Expected average P50 insolation generated in kWh per square meter. The value can be reported for the period defined on the PeriodAxis, for example to record the average insolation for Q1, this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: ExpectInsolationAtP50InceptToDate
label: Expect Insolation At P50 Incept To Date
description: Expected average P50 insolation generated in kWh per square meters from inception to date.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: IrradDiffuseHorizontal

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: IrradDirectNormal
label: Irrad Direct Normal
description: The amount of direct irradiance received per unit area on a surface that is perpendicular (or normal) to the direction of the sun. Direct irradiance, also termed beam irradiance, is not scattered or reflected by the atmosphere, clouds, or other surfaces before arriving at the surface of measurement. Direct normal irradiance is measured in watts per square meter.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: LeaseProRataRent
label: Lease Pro Rata Rent
description: Pro rata rent, which is the difference between rent payable and rent accrued during the previous rental period that is not included otherwise in section 467 balance or in base stipulated loss value.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseProjCostToLessor

name: LeaseProportionalRent
label: Lease Proportional Rent
description: Proportional rent, which is rent accrued for tax purposes. It is a calculated value to show how much rent accrues during the period.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseRentPmt
label: Lease Rent Pmt
description: Rent payment.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseSection467Balance
label: Lease Section467 Balance
description: Section 467 balance, which is the cumulative difference between the amount of rent that has been paid and the amount of rent that has been accrued for tax purposes since the inception of the lease. Represents an amount that, if negative, is the amount the lessor owes to lessee; if positive, represents an amount owed by lessee to lessor.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseSection467LessorBalance
label: Lease Section467 Lessor Balance
description: Section 467 lessor balance, which is the sum of basic rent plus interest plus interest payable on section 467 loan balance (if positive, owed from lessor to lessee).
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseSixMonAvgRent
label: Lease Six Mon Avg Rent
description: Average amount of rent over any 6 month time period during the lifetime of the lease.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: LeaseStipulatedLossValue
label: Lease Stipulated Loss Value
description: Stipulated loss value, which is the net amount starting with the base stipulated loss value minus section 467 balance plus the pro rata rent.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: MaxContOutputPowerDataFor180Minutes
label: Max Cont Output Power Data For180 Minutes
description: Indication if the MCOP (Maximum Continuous Output Power) measured data provided for at least 180 minutes at minimum intervals of 5 minutes. If it was, TRUE; if it was not, FALSE.
validationRule: Boolean values (TRUE or FALSE) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: MaxPctThresholdForPmtOfGuarantee
label: Max Pct Threshold For Pmt Of Guarantee
description: Maximum percent loss at which a refund will be paid which effectively puts a cap on the amount of refund. For example, if a guarantee specifies that a refund will be made when output falls between 95-98%, and the output falls to 97%, the refunded amount will be based on 97%. If the loss falls to 94%, the loss will be based on the maximum allowable amount at 95%. 95% is the maximum threshold for payment. Other penalities may apply if the loss falls below the threshold.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasCapAtTargetConditions
label: Meas Cap At Target Conditions
description: Power measured at the targeted measurement conditions per IEC 61724-2 in kW.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasClass
label: Meas Class
description: Measurement class per IEC 71724 where Class A is highest and Class C is lowest.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: MeasEnergy
label: Meas Energy
description: Energy measured at the revenue meter for the indicated time period according to IEC 61724-3 Section 6.7.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyAvailBalanceOfSystemIssues
label: Meas Energy Avail Balance Of System Issues
description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with Balance of Plant (BOP) components calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to BOP issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasEnergyAvailDifference
label: Meas Energy Avail Difference
description: A PV system or part of a system is considered to be available when it’s status is observed to be functional. Per IECRE 61724-3, this measure can be calculated as simple difference, percent difference, or ratio calculation. This concept should be reported as a Difference, calculated as Measured - Expected.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyAvailPct
label: Meas Energy Avail Pct
description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period calculated from the measured weather data and observed availability which can be obtained by dividing Expected Energy At Revenue Meter by Expected Energy At Unavailable Times. For solar, use IEC 61724-3, Section 6.8.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasEnergyAvailSingleTurbine
label: Meas Energy Avail Single Turbine
description: Measured energy availability for the indicated time period due to issues with the single wind turbine indicated calculated as the ratio of the total energy that could have been produced minus the energy lost due to turbine issues divided by the total energy that could have been produced.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasEnergyAvailableExcludExtOrOtherOutages
label: Meas Energy Available Exclud Ext Or Other Outages
description: Actual energy available excluding times of external or other outage causes per IEC 61724-3 Section 6.8.1.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyAvgForPeriod
label: Meas Energy Avg For Period
description: Computed average energy production for the period defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh. To record the average energy for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the energy over all years of operation since Activation Date (in kWh).
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyLossDueToInverterIssues
label: Meas Energy Loss Due To Inverter Issues
description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to inverter issues.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyLossDueToSoiling
label: Meas Energy Loss Due To Soiling
description: Actual (measured) amount of energy lost due to soiling.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyToWeatherAdj
label: Meas Energy To Weather Adj
description: Ratio of measured energy to measured energy adjusted for weather.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasEnergyWeatherAdj
label: Meas Energy Weather Adj
description: Energy generated over reporting period adjusted for the difference between measured weather conditions, e.g., irradiance and temperature, and expected weather conditions for the same period during the Typical Meteorological Year or the equivalent used to predict P50 energy generation and the expected degradation rate.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasEnergyWeatherAdjAvgForPeriod
label: Meas Energy Weather Adj Avg For Period
description: Computed average energy generated for the period, adjusted for the difference between measured weather conditions, e.g., irradiance and temperature, and expected weather conditions for the same period during the Typical Meteorological Year or the equivalent used to predict P50 energy generation and the expected degradation rate. The period is defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh. To record the average energy for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the energy over all years of operation since Activation Date (in kWh).
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: MeasInsolation
label: Meas Insolation
description: Actual measured insolation generated in kWh per square meter for a specific duration of time. This is used to measure the insolation from one date to another date. This differs from the element SystemPerformanceMeasuredInsolationAverage which is used to measure system performance from activation date to the current date and can be reported by dividing by periods such as months and quarters or years.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasInsolationAvg
label: Meas Insolation Avg
description: Computed average insolation, for the period defined on the PeriodAxis over all years of operation since activation date in kWh/square meter. To record the average insolation for Q1 for example this element would be used with the PeriodFirstQuarterMember on the Period Axis. If the period axis is not used this represents the insolation over the entire life of the project from activation date up to the contextual date.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasInsolationToWeatherAdj
label: Meas Insolation To Weather Adj
description: Actual measured insolation divided by weather adjusted insolation.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasInsolationToWeatherAdjInceptToDate
label: Meas Insolation To Weather Adj Incept To Date
description: Actual measured insolation divided by weather adjusted insolation inception to date.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: MeasScope
label: Meas Scope
description: Scope of the power measurement. Can be "System" for the entire PV system, "Inverter XXX" for a specific inveter, "String YYY" for a specific string.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: MeasUncertaintyBasisDesc
label: Meas Uncertainty Basis Desc
description: Description of standard method used to calculate uncertainity of measurement
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: MechComplCertAvailOfDoc
label: Mech Compl Cert Avail Of Doc

name: PredictedAllInOneYearYield
label: Predicted All In One Year Yield
description: Predicted total (all-in) yield for a one year period.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeter
label: Predicted Energy At The Revenue Meter
description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element is defined as the sum of electrical production over a period of time, for example from the 1st day to the last day of the month, and has a period type of duration. This should not be used with the Period [Axis].
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterForPeriod
label: Predicted Energy At The Revenue Meter For Period
description: Predicted active electrical production at the revenue meter for each year, based on historical weather data that is representative for the site, per IEC 61724-3. Calculated as Total Predicted Energy reflecting times of unavailability and parasitic loss. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time. If no Period [Axis] is used, the time period for the value is from the date of the value in the instance document to the end of the life of the system.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

name: PredictedEnergyAvailEstRatio
label: Predicted Energy Avail Est Ratio
description: Predicted Energy Availability Estimate by Year, which is the modelled predicted energy for unity availability. The ratio is calculated by dividing PredictedEnergyAtTheRevenueMeterInstant by PredictedEnergyAvailable. This element can be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year and has a period type of instant to measure a point in time.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: PredictedEnergyAvailable
label: Predicted Energy Available
description: Predicted energy available is calculated as predicted energy (at unity availability which means that energy is available all the time) multiplied by predicted availability equals predicted energy (at predicted availability). For example, if 10,000 MWh is predicted for unity availability and we predict availability of 0.99, then predicted energy is 9,900 MWh. 10,000=9,900/0.99. This element should be used with the PeriodAxis to indicate the period such as year.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
units: Millions of Barrels of Oil Equivalent

description: Percentage of kWh lost due to snow based on typical meteorogical month, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SnowModelFactorTMYPct
label: Snow Model Factor TMY Pct
description: Percentage of kWh lost due to snow based on typical meteorogical year, calculation based on major design/energy production model used.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: Snowfall
label: Snowfall
description: Amount of snowfall in a given period of time
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SoilInSiteRptAvailable

validationRule: Boolean values (TRUE or FALSE) are valid
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SoilingInstrumentType
label: Soiling Instrument Type
description: Type of soiling instrument.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SoilingModelFactorTMMPct
label: Soiling Model Factor TMM Pct

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SoilingModelFactorTMYPct

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SoilingRatio

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SolarArrayAnnualDegrad

name: SuretyLegalJurisdiction

name: SuretyPrincipal
label: Surety Principal
description: The name of the Principal to a surety bond, which is a promise by a surety or guarantor to pay one party (the obligee) a certain amount if a second party (the principal) fails to meet some obligation, such as fulfilling the terms of a contract.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SuretyPrincipalEmail
label: Surety Principal Email
description: Email address of the Principal to the surety bond.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SuretyWarrTerm
label: Surety Warr Term
description: Term of the surety warranty bond. The value should be entered using the ISO8601 format of PnYnMnDTnHnMnS. For example, a 5-year term would be represented as P5Y, a 3-month term as P3M, and a 4-year, 6-month and 10-day term would be represented as P4Y6M10D.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SwiftCode

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemAvailAchievementReqd
label: System Avail Achievement Reqd

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemAvailAchievementReqdPct
label: System Avail Achievement Reqd Pct
description: Description of the system availability achievement requirement, for example, 98% availability over two years.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemAvailAchievementReqdReconciliationPeriod
label: System Avail Achievement Reqd Reconciliation Period
description: Reconciliation period during which the system availability must be met.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemAvailAchievementReqdReconciliationUnits
label: System Avail Achievement Reqd Reconciliation Units
description: Units, for example, months, years, for the reconciliation period during which the system availability must be met.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemAvailActualPctUptime
label: System Avail Actual Pct Uptime
description: Actual percent uptime of the project during normal operating conditions for a specified month, availability defined per IECRE 61724-3 or through another standard method.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemAvailActualPctUptimeInceptToDate
label: System Avail Actual Pct Uptime Incept To Date
description: Percent uptime of the project during normal operating conditions from inception to date, actual, availability defined per IECRE 61724-3 or through another standard method.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemAvailExpectPctUptime
label: System Avail Expect Pct Uptime
description: Expected percent uptime of the project during normal operating conditions for a specified month, defined per IECRE 61724-3 or through another standard method.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemAvailExpectPctUptimeInceptToDate
label: System Avail Expect Pct Uptime Incept To Date
description: Percent uptime of the project during normal operating conditions from inception to date, expected, availability defined per IECRE 61724-3 or through another standard method.
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemAvailMeasToMeasEnergyPlusLostEnergy
label: System Avail Meas To Meas Energy Plus Lost Energy
description: Plant energy production or plant energy metered in the time period divided by the sum of that value and the calculated lost energy in the period (kWh). Energy-Based Availability takes into consideration that an hour in a period with high irradiance is more valuable than in a period with low irradiance.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemAvailMode
label: System Avail Mode
description: Indicates the system availability mode which can be  Islanded, Standby, Environment, Grid, Shutdown, Forced, or Emergency.
validationRule: Value must be one of the enumerated values listed below:
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemBatteryConnec
label: System Battery Connec
description: Explains how the battery is coupled with the system which can be DC-coupled or AC-coupled.
validationRule: Value must be one of the enumerated values listed below:
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemCapPeakDC
label: System Cap Peak DC
description: DC capacity of the system at Standard Test Condition (STC), often referred to as kWp (kilowatt peak).
validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid
precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified

name: SystemCommercOpDate

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemCostInstallCostsMfr

name: SystemDateCompletedCommiss

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDateElecCompl

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDateFinalAccept

description: Date when owner accepts system, usually approximately one year after operation begins.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDateFinalCompl
label: System Date Final Compl
description: Date when owner accepts system as final per EPC Agreement.

name: SystemDateInterconnAvail

description: Date when all of the equipment is in place, so the installation could connect to the grid, (ready to request PTO - permission to operate), but do not yet have permission.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDateIssueForProcur

name: SystemDateMechCompl

name: SystemDatePlacedInServ
label: System Date Placed In Serv
description: Date at which the installation obtains Placed in Service (PIS) status.This is used for tax purposes and means the system has met the following: (1) It is synched with the grid, (2) it has no major outstanding permits, (3) it has or is capable of commencing delivery of energy to the grid, (4) care, custody and control has been transferred to the operator, (5) critical tests are complete, for example, those required by the EPC and interconnection agreements.
precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDateSubstantialCompl

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDecommDate

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemDegradRate

validationRule: Float values (with or without decimal point) are valid

name: SystemDrawing

precisionDecimals: N/A (neither precision nor decimals may be specified)

name: SystemEPCCost

name: SystemUptimeRatio
label: System Uptime Ratio
description: Measure of system availability (uptime), calculated by taking the ratio of total useful time (time during which the plant is operating without taking any exclusion factors into account) minus total downtime, divided by the total useful time, multipled by 100. Total useful time is defined as the time when the plant is exposed to irradiation levels above the generator’s Minimum Irradiance Threshold (MIT). This measure is sourced from Solar Power Europe.

precisionDecimals: Either Precision or Decimals must be specified
